Ingredients.7: 1 kosher salt and ground black pepper to taste

Ingredients.8: 2 pounds boneless chicken thighs, trimmed of excess fat

Ingredients.11: 1 tablespoon sriracha sauce, or more to taste

Directions.1: Make chicken: Combine olive oil, lemon juice, garlic, oregano, and coriander in a blender; blend until smooth. Season with salt and pepper.

Directions.2: Place chicken thighs in a resealable plastic bag; pour in blended marinade and seal. Refrigerate for 3 to 4 hours.

Directions.3: Make yogurt sauce: Whisk yogurt, sriracha sauce, garlic, salt, and pepper together in a bowl. Refrigerate for 1 hour.

Directions.4: Preheat a skillet over medium-high heat.

Directions.5: Remove chicken from marinade and pat dry with paper towels. Cook skin-side down in the hot skillet until well browned, 4 to 5 minutes. Flip and cook until no longer pink in the center, 4 to 5 minutes more. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).

Directions.6: Let chicken rest for 5 to 10 minutes, then chop into chunks.

Directions.7: Make rice: Melt butter in a large Dutch oven over medium heat. Add turmeric and cumin; cook and stir until fragrant. Add rice and stir to coat. Cook, stirring frequently, until toasted, about 4 minutes. Pour in chicken broth and season with salt and pepper. Bring to a boil; reduce heat, cover, and cook until broth is absorbed, about 15 minutes.

Directions.8: Remove Dutch oven from heat and let stand, covered, for 15 minutes.

Directions.9: Divide rice and chicken among serving bowls. Drizzle yogurt sauce on top.
